name: STRATEGY IMPLEMENTED
goal:
STRATEGY IMPLEMENTED is a strategic leadership executive advisor and consultant office. Its focus is value creation through establishing and enhancing world class brands through leadership, branding & innovation and digitalisation.

STRATEGY IMPLEMENTED steers with passion for winning global leading brand equities which command margin premiums based on superior perceived consumer and customer relevant benefits, images and innovations. This focus increases company marging and market capitalization.

STRATEGY IMPLEMENTED strengthens Austria’s international hub role by serving as "World Capital of Dialogue" (Dialogue platform for international affairs, diplomacy, and peace-making), "European Capital of Infrastructure" (Logistic center for Europe's infrastructure for fossil and renewable energy, broad band, rail, air and water), and "World Capital for Smart Quality Living" (Innovative industrial cluster leader for high tech sustainability and center of music and fine arts).

Its knowledge is based on global top executive experience (P&G, Henkel) in both developed & emerging regions (Europe, USA, Latin America, CEE, MENA and Asia) and worldwide university experiences through MBA merit and research scholarship (Austria, USA, Australia) and on its faculty membership at the triple crown EQUIS/AMBA/AACSB accredited WU Executive Academy for Global and Professional MBA.

STRATEGY IMPLEMENTED is, in addition, frequently invited to speak at international conventions and universities (Vienna, Berlin, Phoenix, St. Gallen, Zurich, Frankfurt, Munich, Mannheim, Copenhagen, Hamburg, Dusseldorf, etc.).

Prevailling topics are strategic business leadership and excellence in operational implementation, brand equity building, consumer centric marketing, cutting edge employer branding, disruptive innovation leadership, successful business turnaround, high performing organizations, performance-based sustainability and digitalisation/ICT-based efficiency.
interests: Agriculture, Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Fraud prevention, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
